bibl.title: Letter fragment from E.W. Mitchel, April 30, 1921

div1.p: Mitchel complains about his problems with the Peruvian government. He encloses a copy of a letter from M.L. Vega regarding his situation.

div1.head: Letter fragment from E.W. Mitchel, April 30, 1921
div1.p:
A/c 1a, 2a, 28a, & 29a you know, without looking, have not been paid.
Concerning the blue numbers, AA1 to EE, aside from the moral oblig-
ation, straight business demands that the Peruvian Government pay
me for the time lost because of their dilatory methods, precedent
shows that others were allowed pay for time, subsistence etc. while
waiting for a steamer and travel time returning to port of original
embarkation, therefore, I claim to be entitled to time and expenses
while waiting for the documents authorizing my travel. There is no
essential difference between the two cases. When I asked Vega to ap-
ply for my transportation he did so immediately. After the custom-
ary delay, the Prefecto advised him that he (the Prefecto) had no
power to issue transportation, according to a new ruling this is
first authorized by the Minister of the department interested.
Instead of cableing for the authority at once, on receipt of Vega's
request, as you or I would have done, the Prefecto writes a letter
to Vega about it, never the less, after Vega made the situation
known to me, the Prefecto did wire on my urgent petition and no
reply from Lima being forthcoming, so did I, and Vega and again the
Prefecto, all of us to the tune of six cables. When I took the cable
(blue no. DD) which you note bears the Prefecto's seal, to the tel-
egraph office the official there informed me that a cable had been
received from Lima that same morning, authorizing the Prefecto to
issue travel papers. Two days later these papers were handed me in
the Prefecto's office. The negociations actually covered a period
of more than a month.

I am sending all the accounts and this letter thru the Peruvian Con-
sulate addressed as follows; "Documentos Oficiales-Pertenecientes
al Dpto. de Salubridad-Mno. de Fomento-Gobierno del Peru-A cargo del
Consulado Peruano Panama---AL Doctor Henry Hanson-Director Camp.
contra F.A. y P.B.- c/o Consulado Americano-Lima-Peru., also another
letter and a copy of this and the resume by post. (See note below.)
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, E. W. MITCHEL. Note: Attention is invited to the attached correspondence from Dr.
Vega, (blue No. Y) a reply to my request that my accounts be
settled, Col. Carter left before the a/c were all in and Dr.
Quiros did not return to Piura during my stay.
Copies;
Col. Carter,
Mail,
File.
66 Enc.
